name: Household & Food Items
description:
Below is a list of items required for a family-in-need. These items will be able to help the family for a month. There is no minimum number required for each item.  We are happy will accept as much as you can help with!

Delivery is appreciated to be arranged by donor. Except for fresh food items, please take note of the expiry dates of the food items and ensure that the items are not expired or near expiry.

1) XL Huggies Pull-ups (2 packs)
2) Any detergent+softener+disinfectant for washing machine
3) Baby Wet Wipes
4) Tissue Boxes
5) Any child - Safe shampoo + shower gel
6) Any child - Safe toothpaste + toothbrush
7) Sunsilk shampoo + conditioner
8) Lifebuoy shower gel
9) Marigold Fresh Milk - White Milk x2, Chocolate Milk x2
10) Jasmine White Rice 5kg x2
11) Fresh foods (Chicken, Fish, Apples, Bananas, Cabbage, Onions) - enough for 2 adults and 3 children, for 1 month
12) Frozen foods (Nuggets, fish fingers, chicken wings etc.)
13) Instant Noodles
14) Children's Cereal
15) White Bread
16) Nescafe Coffee/Super Milk Tea

Thank you!

name: Soft Bolster Pillows x 2
description:
Soft Bolster Pillows x 2
Mdm A is an elderly client known to Thye Hua Kwan Moral Charities (THKMC). She is suffering from bone dislocation on both her knees and has trouble with her ambulation. She is also having trouble sleeping as she said her current bedding accessories are too hard for her. THKMC is looking for two soft bolster pillows to ensure that she is able to have a healthy sleep pattern and a conducive environment to recover. If you know of someone who has the items for donation, please contact Syarifah (Assistant Case Manager) at 9177 6614 or Syarifah.Insyirah@thkmc.org.sg Since October 2011, THKMC was incorporated as a charity with an IPC status to provide multiple social and welfare services to the community at large. THKMC provides assistance to the Elderly, Families, Children & Youth, and Persons with Disabilities, through more than 70 programmes and services. THK Elderly Services Division provides many programmes and services to serve the elderly in need – one of which includes THK Cluster Support. THK Cluster Support provides social support through case management, monitoring, and basic counselling services to vulnerable seniors, and facilitates coordination in the provision of community-based care and support services to the seniors. This service aims to improve the quality of life of vulnerable seniors, particularly for low or no income seniors who are socially-isolated and have minimal or no family support.
